text: The president of Nicaragua (), officially known as the president of the Republic of Nicaragua (), is the head of state of Nicaragua. The office was created in the Constitution of 1854. From 1825 until the Constitution of 1838, the head of state of Nicaragua was styled simply as Head of State (Jefe de Estado), and from 1838 to 1854 as Supreme Director (Supremo Director). The incumbent president, Daniel Ortega, has served as President since 2007."Nicaragua's Ortega takes office", BBC News, January 11, 2007. ==Heads of state of Nicaragua within the Federal Republic of Central America (1821–1838)== {| class="wikitable" ! Name ! Political party ! Dates in office ! Deposed by José Trinidad Muñoz military coup. |- |Justo Abaunza y Muñoz de Avilés |Conservative |4 August – 11 November 1851 |2nd time. Acting senator under the authority of José Trinidad Muñoz, General in Chief, leader of the military coup. |- |José Laureano Pineda Ugarte |Liberal |5 August – 11 August 1851 |In dissent, 2nd time. |- |José Francisco del Montenegro |Liberal |5 August – 11 August 1851 |Government in Granada, died after assuming command. |- |José de Jesús Alfaro |Liberal |11 August – 2 November 1851 |In dissent.
